sentences.en: Don't get the idea that value of music is commensurate with its sensuous appeal.
sentences.cn: 不要以为音乐的价值与其美的感染力相等.

sentences.en: Employees are paid salaries commensurate with those of teachers.
sentences.cn: 给员工的薪水与老师拿的薪水相当。

sentences.en: Her low salary is not commensurate with her abilities.
sentences.cn: 她的薪水很低,与她的能力不相称.

sentences.en: His collection of books was commensurate with that of a town library.
sentences.cn: 他的藏书量与镇上图书馆不相上下.

sentences.en: In his view differences in adaptation are insufficient to create niches commensurate in number and kind.
sentences.cn: 按照他的观点,适应的差异不足以在数量上和种类上形成同量的小生境.

sentences.en: Managers saw a commensurate fall in their revenues.
sentences.cn: 经理们发现自己的收入相应地减少了。

sentences.en: Nothing he does is commensurate to our desire.
sentences.cn: 他做的事没一件使我们称心.

sentences.en: Our company be commensurate to the monstrous beautiful woman colleague!
sentences.cn: 我们公司相当怪异的美女同事!

sentences.en: Salary will be commensurate with experience.
Six yards is commensurate with eighteen feet.
The amino acid is depleted commensurate with the development of the growing embryo.
sentences.cn: 氨基酸的消耗是同生长的胚的发育相适应的.

sentences.en: The pay should be commensurate with the work.
sentences.cn: 工资应与工作相称才是.

sentences.en: The World Bank extends loans to its members on conventional terms commensurate with prevailing interest rates.
sentences.cn: 世界银行以和当时利率相当的通常条件向成员国贷款.

sentences.en: They should give me a salary commensurate with my performance.
sentences.cn: 她们应该支付我跟我表现相当的薪水.

sentences.en: Users make commensurate effort if the rewards justify it.
sentences.cn: 如果回报值得,用户愿意付出相称的努力.

trans.tran_cn: （在时间和空间上）相等的，相称的，相当的
trans.tran_en: matching something in size, quality, or length of time
